result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

Defendant Jesse Kritz in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $500 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim KB, EB or ZB, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May not possess any weapons or firearms. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint by Tuesday, May 31, 2022. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
